intro: Wahlenbergia compacta, commonly known as the dwarf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and produces small, bell-shaped blooms. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Wahlenbergia compacta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
